perturbation.original_text: 1.1 iBio hereby grants to CC-Pharming for the term of this Agreement, a nonexclusive, non- assignable, non-sublicensable, limited right and license to use iBio’s Technology in order to manufacture, process, prepare, and obtain regulatory approval for the development and production of Product(s) and work to be performed under this Agreement. Each Product will be set forth in a separate Statement of Work in the form set forth in Appendix A, which will be signed by representatives of each Party with signing authority. Each phase of the project(s) will be subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement unless otherwise provided for or in a Statement of Work (“SOW”), including but not limited to project purpose, project phases, and a project budget.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 iBio hereby grants to CC-Pharming for the term of this Agreement, a nonexclusive, assignable, sublicensable, limited right and license to use iBio’s Technology in order to manufacture, process, prepare, and obtain regulatory approval for the development and production of Product(s) and work to be performed under this Agreement. Each Product will be set forth in a separate Statement of Work in the form set forth in Appendix A, which will be signed by representatives of each Party with signing authority. Each phase of the project(s) will be subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement unless otherwise provided for or in a Statement of Work (“SOW”), including but not limited to project purpose, project phases, and a project budget.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'non-assignable' and 'non-sublicensable' to 'assignable' and 'sublicensable,' I've created a contradiction. Later clauses may assume CC-Pharming cannot assign or sublicense the technology, which is now untrue based on this modified clause. This affects the certainty of rights and obligations related to technology transfer.

perturbation.original_text: 7.3 Each of the parties agrees that for five (5) years from the date of disclosure, the receiving Party agrees to limit disclosure of the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information to those of the receiving party’s employees and contractors, and employees and contractors of its Subsidiaries, who have a need to know it, and the receiving Party agrees to use the same care and discretion to avoid disclosure, publication or dissemination outside of those employees and contractors as the receiving Party does with similar information of its own which it does not desire to publish, disclose or disseminate.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.3 Each of the parties agrees that for five (5) years from the date of disclosure, the receiving Party agrees to limit disclosure of the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information to those of the receiving party’s employees and contractors, and employees and contractors of its Subsidiaries, who have a need to know it, and the receiving Party may disclose such confidential information to any third party without restriction. The receiving Party agrees to use the same care and discretion to avoid disclosure, publication or dissemination outside of those employees and contractors as the receiving Party does with similar information of its own which it does not desire to publish, disclose or disseminate.
perturbation.explanation: The initial part of the clause restricts disclosure, while the added phrase 'may disclose such confidential information to any third party without restriction' directly contradicts this. This introduces uncertainty about the actual confidentiality obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 9.8 Assignment. Neither Party may assign its rights or delegate any of its duties under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party. Any unauthorized assignment of this Agreement is void.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.8 Assignment. Either Party may assign its rights or delegate any of its duties under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may assign the agreement without consent to an affiliate.
perturbation.explanation: The first sentence states that assignment requires prior written consent, the second sentence allows either party to assign the agreement without consent if it's to an affiliate. This creates a contradiction regarding when consent is needed for assignment, creating uncertainty and potential for disputes.
